dataFeed.name: January
dataFeed.info: Chaitra begins with the new moon in April. The first day of this month is called Gudi Padwa, which marks the day of Hindu new year.

dataFeed.name: February
dataFeed.info: 28/29 Vaishakh is season of crop harvesting and the second month of hindu calendar.

dataFeed.name: March
dataFeed.info: Maharashtrians celebrate vat purnima in this month. This is third month of hindu calendar.

dataFeed.name: April
dataFeed.info: In this fourth month, Maharashtrians celebrate Gurupurnima and ashadi ekadashi celebrate.

dataFeed.name: May
dataFeed.info: This fifth month brings also the festivals of Naagpanchimi and Narali purnima.

dataFeed.name: June
dataFeed.info: This is month marks the festival of Ganesh Chaturthi.

dataFeed.name: July
dataFeed.info: Navratri, Durga puja, Kojagiri, Dasra, and Diwali are all festivals celebrated in the seventh month of Ashwin.

dataFeed.name: August
dataFeed.info: Lakshmi pujan implies the worship of godess Lakshmi & Bhaubeej is celebrated in the month of Kartik.

dataFeed.name: September
dataFeed.info: Shree Dutta Jayanti celebrated in the month of Margashirsh

dataFeed.name: October
dataFeed.info: Makar sankranti is celebrated in this month & Paush अमावस्या is also celebrated in this month.

dataFeed.name: November
dataFeed.info: Mahashivratri is celebrated in this month. On this day, people worship lord Mahadev.

dataFeed.name: December
dataFeed.info: This is last month in the Hindu calendar. Holi is celebrated in this month.
